Name: Garganey
How_to_identify: Males have a distinctive white stripe from the beak through the eye; brownish body. Females are mottled brown.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Males: Grey, brown, with white stripe. Females: Mottled brown

Name: Northern Shoveler
How_to_identify: Males have a green head, white chest, and large spoon-shaped bill. Females are mottled brown with a large bill.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Males: Green, white, brown. Females: Mottled brown

Name: Gadwall
How_to_identify: Males have a subtle brownish-grey body with a black rear. Females are mottled brown. Both have a white wing patch.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Males: Brownish-grey, black, white. Females: Mottled brown
Diet: Aquatic vegetation, small fish, and invertebrates

Name: Falcated Duck
How_to_identify: Males have a glossy green head, grey body, and long, sickle-shaped feathers. Females are mottled brown.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Males: Green, grey. Females: Mottled brown

Name: Eurasian Wigeon
How_to_identify: Males have a reddish head with a buff crown, grey body. Females are mottled brown with a less distinct face pattern.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Males: Reddish, grey. Females: Mottled brown
Diet: Aquatic plants, seeds, occasionally small invertebrates

Name: Indian Spot-billed Duck
How_to_identify: Greyish body with distinctive black spots on the bill, a yellow tip. Black wing tips with white spots visible in flight.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Grey, black spots, white wing spots
Diet: Aquatic vegetation, grains, small fish, and invertebrates

Name: Eastern Spot-billed Duck
How_to_identify: Similar to the Indian Spot-billed Duck but with slightly different vocalizations and minor plumage differences.

Name: Mallard
How_to_identify: Males have a green head, white collar, and chestnut-brown chest. Females are mottled brown. Both have a blue wing patch.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Males: Green, chestnut, white. Females: Mottled brown
Diet: Plants, seeds, small invertebrates, and fish

Name: Northern Pintail
How_to_identify: Males have a chocolate brown head, white neck, and a long tail. Females are mottled brown with a shorter tail.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Males: Brown, white. Females: Mottled brown
Diet: Aquatic vegetation, seeds, and small invertebrates

Name: Eurasian Teal
How_to_identify: Males have a chestnut head with a green eye patch, grey body. Females are mottled brown with a less distinct face pattern.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Males: Chestnut, green, grey. Females: Mottled brown
